thread.title: Manny Pacquiao says he'll be ready to fight again in March
thread.title_full: Manny Pacquiao says he'll be ready to fight again in March - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Manny Pacquiao says he'll be ready to fight again in March
text:
EDUARDO MUNOZ/REUTERS From his philanthropic work to boxing to running for the Philippine Senate, Manny Pacquiao is as active as ever. Manny Pacquiao, in New York to accept an award at the United Nations, says he will be ready to get in the ring again around March of next year.
"My shoulder is 80 to 90 percent healed and I believe I can start training in November or December so I can fight early next year," Pacquiao said Monday at the Asia Society, which is honoring the Philippine boxer at its Asia Game Changer Awards on Tuesday at the UN.
Pacquiao lost to Floyd Mayweather Jr on May 2 in what was billed beforehand as the "Fight of the Century." After that contest it was revealed that Pacquiao had suffered a torn rotator cuff in his right shoulder while training and had reinjured it in the fourth round. He underwent arthroscopic surgery on May 7.
On Monday, Pacquiao was asked about British fighter Amir Khan as a potential opponent, but said nothing is decided.
"Actually that's one other names that my promoter gave to me," said Pacquiao. "We are friendly, but when you are in the ring there is no friend."
Pacquiao also said he expects to file paperwork later this week to start his bid for a seat in the Philippine Senate. Pacquiao is already a congressman in the Philippines, where he has lent his support to bills addressing human trafficking, healthcare and teacher salaries.
"I'm running because I really believe I can help more people," said Pacquiao.
